events.originalText: Andrei Karlov (pictured), Russia's ambassador to Turkey, was assassinated at an art gallery in Ankara.
events.subtitle: Andrei Karlov
events.headline: Russian Ambassador Andrei Karlov Assassinated in Ankara

events.originalText: The European Space Agency's spacecraft Gaia was launched with the goal of constructing the largest and most precise star catalogue ever made.
events.subtitle: European Space Agency
events.headline: European Space Agency Launches Gaia for Star Catalogue

events.originalText: Titanic, the third-highest-grossing film of all time, with a worldwide total of more than US$1.8 billion, was released in the United States.
events.subtitle: Titanic (1997 film)
events.headline: Titanic Released in US, Grosses Over US$1.8 Billion

events.originalText: SilkAir Flight 185 crashed into the Musi River in Indonesia, killing 104 people.
events.subtitle: SilkAir Flight 185
events.headline: SilkAir Flight 185 Crashes in Indonesia, 104 Dead

events.originalText: Aeroflot Flight 101/435 was hijacked by the co-pilot and landed in a cow pasture in China, where he was apprehended.
events.subtitle: Aeroflot Flight 101/435
events.headline: Aeroflot Flight 101/435 Hijacked, Lands in China

events.originalText: China and the United Kingdom signed the Sino-British Joint Declaration, agreeing to the transfer of sovereignty of Hong Kong to China on 1 July 1997.
events.subtitle: Sino-British Joint Declaration
events.headline: China and UK Sign Sino-British Joint Declaration

events.originalText: The Jules Rimet Trophy, awarded to the winner of the FIFA World Cup, was stolen from the offices of the Brazilian Football Confederation.
events.subtitle: FIFA World Cup Trophy
events.headline: Jules Rimet Trophy Stolen from Brazilian Football Confederation

events.originalText: The ruling junta of South Vietnam, led by Nguyễn Khánh, initiated a coup, dissolving the High National Council, a civilian advisory body.
events.subtitle: South Vietnam
events.headline: South Vietnam Junta Led by Nguyễn Khánh Initiates Coup

events.originalText: British physician and suspected serial killer John Bodkin Adams was arrested in connection with the death of Edith Alice Morrell.
events.subtitle: John Bodkin Adams
events.headline: Suspected Serial Killer John Bodkin Adams Arrested

events.originalText: A Christmas Carol (illustration pictured), a novella by Charles Dickens about the miser Ebenezer Scrooge and his transformation after being visited by ghosts, was published.
events.subtitle: A Christmas Carol
events.headline: A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens Published

events.originalText: Nullification crisis: American vice president John C. Calhoun's South Carolina Exposition and Protest, written to protest the Tariff of Abominations, was presented to the South Carolina House of Representatives.
events.subtitle: Nullification crisis
events.headline: Nullification Crisis: John C. Calhoun's Protest Presented

events.originalText: Thomas Paine published the first in a series of pamphlets entitled The American Crisis, opening with the line: "These are the times that try men's souls."
events.subtitle: Thomas Paine
events.headline: Thomas Paine Publishes The American Crisis Pamphlets

events.originalText: King Philip's War: In the Great Swamp Fight, the colonial militia of New England and their Pequot allies attacked a Narragansett fort in Rhode Island, killing many warriors and hundreds of non-combatants.
events.subtitle: King Philip's War
events.headline: Great Swamp Fight in King Philip's War Kills Many

events.originalText: Henry II was crowned king of England in Westminster Abbey, London.
events.subtitle: Henry II of England
events.headline: Henry II Crowned King of England in Westminster Abbey
